title: A Leader Supports a Future President
summary: Erika Kirk, who leads a group called Turning Point USA, said she wants JD Vance to be president in 2028. She spoke at a big meeting of the group in Phoenix. JD Vance is the vice president now and was a friend of her husband, Charlie Kirk, who started Turning Point USA but died last year. Erika Kirk told people at the meeting that her group will help Republicans win elections and get JD Vance elected. JD Vance will talk at the meeting too. The article says JD Vance might have a hard time keeping everyone together if he runs for president because some people in the group are arguing with each other after Charlie Kirk's death.

questions.correct_answer: People in the group are arguing

background_read: This article is about politics in the United States. Erika Kirk is the new leader of Turning Point USA, a group that supports conservative ideas for young people. Her husband, Charlie Kirk, started the group but died last year. JD Vance is the current vice president and might run for president in 2028. The article talks about how Erika Kirk supports him and how there are arguments in the group after Charlie Kirk's death. It helps us understand how people in politics support each other and work together.
Article_Structure: WHO: Erika Kirk, leader of Turning Point USA, and JD Vance, the vice president
WHAT: Erika Kirk said she supports JD Vance for president in 2028 at a conference
WHERE: At the Turning Point USA conference in Phoenix
WHY: To show support for JD Vance and help Republicans win elections, but there are arguments in the group after Charlie Kirk's death

perspectives.description: Erika Kirk and Turning Point USA are backing JD Vance for a future presidential run, showing how political groups can influence elections.
